results.title: The Defense Rests? Scott Turow’s Favorite Lawyer Is 85 and Still Arguing
results.abstract: In “The Last Trial,” Turow’s recurring character Sandy Stern defends a Nobel-winning doctor against charges of murder and insider trading.

results.title: Bafflement Greets Boris Johnson’s Plan for Reopening Britain
results.abstract: Critics say the government has failed to answer some basic questions. Among them: 1) when to return to work and 2) how to get there.
results.byline: BY STEPHEN CASTLE AND MARK LANDLER

results.title: How to Create a Pandemic Depression
results.abstract: Opening the economy too soon can backfire, badly.

results.title: Trump’s Taxes and the Supreme Court: What You Need to Know
results.abstract: The court will hear highly anticipated arguments over whether the president’s accountants and bankers must disclose information about his financial affairs.
org_facet: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

multimedia.caption: The Supreme Court will hear cases concerning whether President Trump can block subpoenas to his accountants and bankers from Congress and New York prosecutors.

results.title: Ex-Justice Dept. Officials Lash Out at Barr Over Flynn and Stone Cases
results.abstract: The attorney general’s interventions damaged the Justice Department, argued the former officials, who were directly involved in the cases of the two Trump allies.
des_facet: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

results.title: Washington, the Nation’s Capital, Moves to Reopen. Washington, the City, Is Not Ready.
results.abstract: As the coronavirus hits the White House, Congress and D.C.’s poorest areas, many across the region are asking the Trump administration to proceed with caution.

multimedia.caption: The Rev. Dr. Jo Ann Browning at a food drive organized by the Ebenezer A.M.E. Church in Fort Washington, Md. Washington and close-knit counties in Virginia and Maryland are more interwoven than perhaps any metro area in the country.

results.title: NBC Trades Radio City for a Livestream to Give Advertisers a Taste of Fall
results.abstract: Well, there was a trailer for one new show: “Mr. Mayor,” a sitcom co-created by Tina Fey and starring Ted Danson.
results.byline: BY JOHN KOBLIN AND TIFFANY HSU

multimedia.caption: NBCUniversal showed a trailer for just one fall show at its presentation on Monday: “Mr. Mayor,” starring Ted Danson.

results.title: New Workhorses for Your Spice Drawer
results.abstract: Burlap and Barrel now sells a fundamentals collection, with six everyday spices to elevate your cooking.

results.title: An Australian Soap Opera Returns, With Distance (and No Kissing)
results.abstract: The long-running “Neighbours” is one of the world’s first live-action series to return to set since the coronavirus outbreak. Its new safety rules could point a way forward for the struggling entertainment industry.

multimedia.caption: Eve Morey and Ryan Moloney during a more intimate era of “Neighbours.” The soap opera resumed production in late April, but the actors are keeping their distance.
Eve Morey and Ryan Moloney during a more intimate era of “Neighbours.” The soap opera resumed production in late April, but the actors are keeping their distance.

results.title: Little Richard Wasn’t Conceited. He Was Underappreciated.
results.abstract: After his career in music, the rock ’n’ roll innovator took up the task of maintaining his legacy — because nobody else was going to do it.

multimedia.caption: Little Richard brought glorious ridiculousness to rock ’n’ roll. Then he had to watch everyone else borrow from his innovations.
Little Richard brought glorious ridiculousness to rock ’n’ roll. Then he had to watch everyone else borrow from his innovations.

results.title: Sea Urchins Star in This Food Film
results.abstract: A new documentary, now available to stream, looks at the history and habitat of the delicacy.

results.title: Now From Mexico: Corn Whiskey
results.abstract: Abasolo Ancestral Corn Whisky, made from nixtamalized corn, has a toasty aroma and some honeyed sweetness.

results.title: For Your Ears Only: Broadway’s New Stage Is a Mic
results.abstract: With theaters shuttered, a host of audio dramas and musicals have popped up, and actors are honing a skill: creating characters with just their voices.

multimedia.caption: “There’s a reason that people crowded around their radios during the Great Depression,” Annaleigh Ashford says. “Because it was an escape.” The actress Beatrice Lillie, who first appeared on Broadway in 1924, was also a radio star.
multimedia.copyright: Pictorial Parade/Archive Photos, via Getty Images

results.title: Acupuncture May Ease Indigestion
results.abstract: Feelings of bloating and fullness were relieved by use of acupuncture needles.

results.title: M.L.B. Proposes an 82-Game Season Starting in July
results.abstract: The proposal, which would require approval from the players’ union, would have teams start the season in early July and mainly play teams in their geographic region.

multimedia.caption: Major League Baseball team owners have agreed on a plan to return to baseball in early July, sending a proposal to the players’ union for an 82-game season with an expanded playoff field.

results.abstract: Tuesday’s hearing before the Senate Health Committee will be a chance for Dr. Anthony S. Fauci and other top health experts to speak to lawmakers, albeit by video, without President Trump nearby.

results.abstract: The country star’s “Here and Now” beat Drake’s “Dark Lane Demo Tapes,” but Chesney’s tally was bolstered by sales from tickets to now-postponed concerts.
